title: 820-2838 won`t power up
message:
Hello. This is my first post on this forum :)


I have a macbook air 13 "it will not boot.
   
  it shows green light in mega safe, but it won`t start up. (Not change to orange when battery is connected)
   
  (I`am not an expert have never repaired LB before, but wish to learn)
  
 
  For power up 820-2838 i need:
   
  1)PPDCIN_S5_S5 VOLTAGE=18.5V
   
  2)PPBUS_G3H VOLTAGE=8.4V
   
  3)PPBUS_G3H_ISNS VOLTAGE=8.4V
   
  4)PP3V42_G3H VOLTAGE=3.42V
   
  5)PP3V3_S5  VOLTAGE=3.3V
   
  Right?
   
  I don`t have to check all components on same circuits?
   
  What I have on the circuits are:
   
  1) PPDCIN_S5_S5 VOLTAGE=3D16.7V OK
   
  2) PPBUS_G3H VOLTAGE=3D8.4V  OK
   
  3) PPBUS_G3H_ISNS VOLTAGE=3D8.4V OK
   
  4) PP3V42_G3H VOLTAGE=3D3.42V OK
   
  5) PP3V3_S5  VOLTAGE= 0.33V NOT OK! 
  
Do I have to measure all the S5 S3 ENET S0 lines to?
   
  Tank you for answer me and help :)

 
   
  Regards, 
   
  Glenn

title: 820-2838 won`t power up
message:
Check for short on this rail:
Diode Mode - red on GND & black on rail.

If there is no short look at U7201 TPS51980:
- check VIN-Pin23
- check EN-Pin21

what do you measure?

title: 820-2838 won`t power up
message:
Measure L7260 in diode mode (->+) with RED probe on GND and BLACK probe on L7260 without charger.
Put it then in volt mode and measure PIN 23&21 with the charger plugged in.

title: 820-2838 won`t power up
message:
You can say there is no short to ground on the Rail.
I missed to say EN PIN12 has to be high to make the whole chip to work.
[SIZE=12px][COLOR=#000000]PIN12: P5V3V3_REG_EN comes from SMC_PM_G2_EN[/COLOR]![/SIZE]
Is this signal present?

Can you list up all EN pins? Voltages?

title: 820-2838 won`t power up
message:
Is u7840 that one who registered battery too?

title: 820-2838 won`t power up
message:
U7000 is responsible for PPBUS_GH3 and charging. 
I don't think it is faulty because you have PPBUS 8,4V
For charging it has to communicate with the SMC and the battery. If it can't communicate there is something wrong with the data lines (Page42) or current sense resistors (Pins 17,18,27,28) but first things first.
Make sure all your S5 Rails come up then take care of the data lines!

title: 820-2838 won`t power up
message: Remove R7252 and see if P3V3S5_EN comes up to 3.3V. If yes then U7201 is dead.

title: 820-2838 won`t power up
message: I asked what happened to P3V3S5_EN. Is it still 1,56V?

title: 820-2838 won`t power up
message:
The reason duke asked you to remove R7252 is because this is what sits between the enable signal and U7201. If U7201 is fucked and shorting to ground, it will pull that enable signal to ground as well. We are pulling off R7252 as a way to isolate where the issue is. 

We have one of two issues.

1) P3V3S5_EN is being CREATED, but shorted to ground by defective U7201(replace U7201 as solution)
2) P3V3S5_EN is not being created at all(investigate why P3V3S5_EN is missing as solution)

Measure P3V3S5_EN without R7252 here.

You should follow the advice, but also ask in your head, [I]why is duke asking me to do this? [/I]If you do this you will catch up with our reasoning and troubleshooting methods far faster than if you just follow what we say! Nothing will "happen" when R7252 is removed because R7252 being removed removes the path between the 3.3v rail enable signal and the chip responsible for 3.3v creation. This advice is not intended as a fix, but rather, as a troubleshooting tactic.

title: 820-2838 won`t power up
message: Powering it up without U7201 may also cause everything to fry. Without U7201 there is nothing to control the FETS and they can pass full PPBUS voltage to 3V or 5V bus. This thing is now fucked.
